data.title: Climate of Germany
data.text:
Germany has a mostly continental climate. Most of the time summers are warm and winters are cold.

The highest temperature ever recorded in Germany was 41.2 °C (106.2 °F) on 25 July 2019 in Duisburg and Tönisvorst.[1]

The lowest temperature ever recorded in Germany was −45.9 °C (−50.6 °F) on 24 December 2001 at Funtensee, near Berchtesgaden.[2]

The highest 24-hour rainfall record for Germany is 312 millimeters on 13 August 2002 at Zinnwald, Ore Mountains.[3]

The highest wind gust ever recorded in Germany was 335 km/h (208 mph) on 12 June 1985 at the Zugspitze.[4]
